intro: Sekika nipponica, commonly known as the Japanese spurge, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream sides. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
